lyrics:
Another head hangs lowly
Child is slowly taken
And the violence causes silence

Who are we mistaken?

But you see, it′s not me
It's not my family
In your head, in your head
They are fighting

With their tanks, and their bombs
And their bombs, and their drones
In your head, in your head
They are crying (crying)

What′s in your head, in your head?
Zombie, zombie, zombie-ie-ie!
What's in your head, in your head?
Zombie, zombie, zombie-ie-ie-ie, oh!

Another mother's breaking
Heart is taking over
When the violence causes silence
We must be mistaken

It′s the same old theme
In two thousand eighteen
In your head, in your head
They′re still fighting (fighting)

With their tanks, and their bombs
And their guns, and their drones
In your head, in your head
They are dying (dying)

What's in your head, in your head?
Zombie, zombie, zombie-ie-ie!
What′s in your head, in your head?
Zombie, zombie, zombie-ie-ie-ie, oh!

It's the same old theme
In two thousand eighteen
In your head, in your head
They are dying (dying)

What′s in your head, in your head?
Zombie, zombie, zombie-ie-ie!
What's in your head, in your head?
Zombie, zombie, zombie-ie-ie-ie!

Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh
Eh-hey-oh
Ah-ah-ah
imageDescription: A simple image that represents the song "Zombie" by The Cranberries is a broken heart, with tears streaming down, surrounded by barbed wire. The heart symbolizes the pain caused by violence, while the barbed wire represents the barriers that prevent understanding and resolution. The tears reflect the sadness and mourning for the lives lost.
